inlineContent.text: I’m starting to falter on my habits. I’m losing the motivation to continue to create every day. I’ve written something every day for 144 days and I feel like I’m starting to run out of things to say.
That’s strange though because new things keep happening. That means I must have new things to talk about and that makes me think I’m getting tired or lazy.

This is the point where I push through and put one foot in front of the other. What I write might not be very good during this slog, but I’ll get through it and to the other side. I know this is good for me and I have to force myself to do it even when most of me wants to stop.

abstract.text: David Brunow, known as Brunow [ˈbɹunoʊ] to the folks he works with, is a human living on Earth. You might have something in common with him — if you think it is ridiculous that he is talking about himself in the first person here, so does he.
